benchmark_details.name: LLMTrace
benchmark_details.overview: LLMTrace is a large-scale, bilingual corpus designed to support two key tasks: traditional full-text binary classification (human vs. AI) and AI-generated interval detection, facilitated by character-level annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate a new wave of research into more nuanced, practical, and robust AI detection models.

data.source: Constructed using a diverse range of modern proprietary and open-source LLMs.
data.annotation: Character-level annotations marking all AI-generated spans within mixed texts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the evaluation of models against train, validation, and test subsets.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics indicate the model's performance in classifying text as human or AI-generated, as well as correctly identifying intervals of AI-generated content.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 scores for the classification tasks are reported as follows: English-only model F1: 98.64%, Russian-only model F1: 98.62%. Detection task mAP@0.5 for English-only is 0.8749 and for Russian-only is 0.8928.
methodology.validation: Validated through domain and length balanced sampling strategies.
